newsitem.title: USA: Arvin files for $100 mln in securities.
newsitem.headline: Arvin files for $100 mln in securities.

text.p: A business trust formed by Arvin Industries Inc said Monday it filed a registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $100 million in trust originated preferred securities.
The trust, known as Arvin Capital I will used the proceeds from the offering to invest in subordinated debt securities of the parent, the filing said.
The offering will be made through Merrill Lynch & Co, Dean Witter Reynolds Inc, A.G. Edwards & Sons Inc, PaineWebber Inc, Salomon Brothers Inc and Lehman Brothers.
The parent in turn will use the funds for to repay short-term bank borrowings and for general corporate purposes, the filing said.
Arvin Industries, of Columbus, Indiana, is a worldwide manufacturer of vehicle exhaust systems and ride control products for both original equipment and replacement customers.
